Package com.intellij.lang.annotation

Class ExternalAnnotator<InitialInfoType,AnnotationResultType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.lang.annotation.ExternalAnnotator<InitialInfoType,AnnotationResultType>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Pep8ExternalAnnotator, RngSchemaValidator, ShShellcheckExternalAnnotator, WebReferencesAnnotatorBase, XMLExternalAnnotator, YouTrackHighlightingAnnotator

    public abstract class ExternalAnnotator<InitialInfoType,AnnotationResultType>
extends java.lang.Object
    Implemented by a custom language plugin to process the files in a language by an external annotation tool ("linter"). External annotators are expected to be (relatively) slow and are started after regular annotators have completed their work.

    Annotators work in three steps:

    1. collectInformation(PsiFile, Editor, boolean) is called to collect some data about a file needed for launching a tool
    2. collected data is passed to doAnnotate(InitialInfoType) which executes a tool and collect highlighting data
    3. highlighting data is applied to a file by apply(com.intellij.psi.PsiFile, AnnotationResultType, com.intellij.lang.annotation.AnnotationHolder)
    See Also:
    ExternalLanguageAnnotators

    • Method Detail

      • collectInformation

        public InitialInfoType collectInformation(PsiFile file)
        See Also:
        collectInformation(PsiFile, Editor, boolean)

      • collectInformation

        public InitialInfoType collectInformation(PsiFile file,
                                          Editor editor,
                                          boolean hasErrors)
        Collects initial information needed for launching a tool. This method is called within a read action; non-DumbAware annotators are skipped during indexing.
        Parameters:
        file - a file to annotate
        editor - an editor in which file's document reside
        hasErrors - indicates if file has errors detected by preceding analyses
        Returns:
        information to pass to ExternalAnnotator#doAnnotate(InitialInfoType), or null if not applicable

      • doAnnotate

        public AnnotationResultType doAnnotate(InitialInfoType collectedInfo)
        Collects full information required for annotation. This method is intended for long-running activities and will be called outside a read action; implementations should either avoid accessing indices and PSI or perform needed checks and locks themselves.
        Parameters:
        collectedInfo - initial information gathered by collectInformation(com.intellij.psi.PsiFile)
        Returns:
        annotations to pass to ExternalAnnotator#apply(PsiFile, AnnotationResultType, AnnotationHolder)

      • apply

        public void apply(PsiFile file,
                  AnnotationResultType annotationResult,
                  AnnotationHolder holder)
        Applies collected annotations to the given annotation holder. This method is called within a read action.
        Parameters:
        file - a file to annotate
        annotationResult - annotations collected in ExternalAnnotator#doAnnotate(InitialInfoType)
        holder - a container for receiving annotations

      • getPairedBatchInspectionShortName

        public java.lang.String getPairedBatchInspectionShortName()

        Returns an inspection that should run in batch mode.

        When inspection with short name is disabled, then annotator won't run in the editor via ExternalToolPass. Implementing ExternalAnnotatorBatchInspection and extending LocalInspectionTool or GlobalSimpleInspectionTool would provide implementation for a batch tool that would run without read action, according to the doAnnotate(Object) documentation.
